metadata.description:
One of the many Are.na co-founders 🎩

http://charlesbroskoski.com

This channel serves the site http://mac.are.na , a collaborative music player.

To contribute, add youtube, soundcloud or mp3s to a channel (any other types will be ignored), and then connect that channel here!

Source code here: https://github.com/broskoski/mac.are.na

One of the many Are.na co-founders 🎩

http://charlesbroskoski.com

contents.content_html:
If you use IFTTT and have a Gmail account associated you can use their new apps Do Camera and Do Note to add items directly from your phone to your channels.

The email subject defines your target channel, so you can add multiple buttons directed to different channels.

Just search "are.na" from the app to add these recipes:

  • https://ifttt.com/recipes/264425-add-photo-to-an-are-na-channel
  • https://ifttt.com/recipes/264426-add-note-link-to-an-are-na-channel

The apps:

  • https://ifttt.com/products/do/camera
  • https://ifttt.com/products/do/note

contents.title: Åzone Futures Market
contents.description_html: Åzone Futures Market is a Guggenheim online exhibition that enables you to take a position on the future of a world increasingly shaped by emerging technologies. Read more Sign up and receive 10,000Å of Åzone currency to invest in a dynamic market of future conditions.

contents.title: Are.na / Import
contents.description_html:
To import your links to Are.na, start by exporting your bookmarks as an HTML file.

We currently support importing data from Pinboard, Pocket, Diigo, Delicious and browser bookmarks.

  • Instructions for Chrome
  • Instructions for Firefox
  • Instructions for Safari
  • Instructions for Pinboard links
  • Instructions for Pocket links

It currently works pretty well, but we'd be happy to get some help cleaning up the css a little.

contents.title: Colourblind friendly Are.na CSS
contents.content_html:
@-moz-document domain("are.na") {
div[visibility="closed"]::before, div[data-class="Channel"] .grid__block__inner--closed::before {
color: rgb(75, 61, 103);
content:"closed";
position: absolute;
top: 10px;
left: 10px;
font-size: 0.8125rem;
}
div[visibility="public"]::before, div[data-class="Channel"] .grid__block__inner--public::before {
color: rgb(23, 172, 16);
content:"public";
position: absolute;
top: 10px;
left: 10px;
font-size: 0.8125rem;
}
div[visibility="private"]::before, div[data-class="Channel"] .grid__block__inner--private::before {
color: rgb(182, 2, 2);
content:"private";
position: absolute;
top: 10px;
left: 10px;
font-size: 0.8125rem;
}
a[style="color:#4b3d67"]::after, .privacy--closed::after {
content:"closed";
font-size: 0.8125rem;
margin-left: 5px;
vertical-align: top;
}
a[style="color:#17ac10"]::after, .privacy--public::after {
content:"public";
font-size: 0.8125rem;
margin-left: 5px;
vertical-align: top;
}
a[style="color:#b60202"]::after, .privacy--private::after {
content:"private";
font-size: 0.8125rem;
margin-left: 5px;
vertical-align: top;
}
}
contents.description_html:
I'm colourblind and Are.na's UI is not great for colourblind.

This adds another non-colour indicator to collections. This ways its possible for colourblind to actually see the difference between public, private and closed collections.

Import with Stylish or Firefox's userContent.css
contents.description:
I'm colourblind and Are.na's UI is not great for colourblind. 

This adds another non-colour indicator to collections. This ways its possible for colourblind to actually see the difference between public, private and closed collections.

Import with Stylish or Firefox's userContent.css
